trans-unit.source: Using Azure AD Connect Health with AD FS | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Using Azure AD Connect Health with AD FS | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This is the Azure AD Connect Health page how to monitor your on-premises AD FS infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: This is the Azure AD Connect Health page how to monitor your on-premises AD FS infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure AD Connect Health with AD FS
trans-unit.target: Using Azure AD Connect Health with AD FS

trans-unit.source: The following documentation is specific to monitoring your AD FS infrastructure with Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: The following documentation is specific to monitoring your AD FS infrastructure with Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Alerts for AD FS
trans-unit.target: Alerts for AD FS

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect Health Alerts section provides you the list of active alerts.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect Health Alerts section provides you the list of active alerts.

trans-unit.source: Each alert includes relevant information, resolution steps, and links to related documentation.
trans-unit.target: Each alert includes relevant information, resolution steps, and links to related documentation.

trans-unit.source: By selecting an active or resolved alert you will see a new blade with additional information, as well as steps you can take to resolve the alert, and links to additional documentation.
trans-unit.target: By selecting an active or resolved alert you will see a new blade with additional information, as well as steps you can take to resolve the alert, and links to additional documentation.

trans-unit.source: You can also view historical data on alerts that were resolved in the past.
trans-unit.target: You can also view historical data on alerts that were resolved in the past.

trans-unit.source: By selecting an alert you will be provided with additional information as well as steps you can take to resolve the alert and links to additional documentation.
trans-unit.target: By selecting an alert you will be provided with additional information as well as steps you can take to resolve the alert and links to additional documentation.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Portal

trans-unit.source: Usage Analytics for AD FS
trans-unit.target: Usage Analytics for AD FS

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Usage Analytics analyzes the authentication traffic of your federation servers.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Usage Analytics analyzes the authentication traffic of your federation servers.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the usage analytics box will open the usage analytics blade, which will show you the metrics and groupings.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the usage analytics box will open the usage analytics blade, which will show you the metrics and groupings.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] In order to use Usage Analytics with AD FS, you must ensure that AD FS auditing is enabled.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In order to use Usage Analytics with AD FS, you must ensure that AD FS auditing is enabled.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Enable Auditing for AD FS](active-directory-aadconnect-health-operations.md#enable-auditing-for-ad-fs).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Enable Auditing for AD FS](active-directory-aadconnect-health-operations.md#enable-auditing-for-ad-fs).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Portal

trans-unit.source: To select additional metrics, specify a time range, or to change the grouping, simply right-click on the usage analytics chart and select Edit Chart.
trans-unit.target: To select additional metrics, specify a time range, or to change the grouping, simply right-click on the usage analytics chart and select Edit Chart.

trans-unit.source: Then you can specify the time range, change or select metrics and change the grouping.
trans-unit.target: Then you can specify the time range, change or select metrics and change the grouping.

trans-unit.source: You can view the distribution of the authentication traffic based on different "metrics" and group each metric using relevant "group by" parameters described below.
trans-unit.target: You can view the distribution of the authentication traffic based on different "metrics" and group each metric using relevant "group by" parameters described below.

trans-unit.source: Metric
trans-unit.target: Metric

trans-unit.source: Group By
trans-unit.target: Group By

trans-unit.source: What the grouping means and why it's useful?
trans-unit.target: What the grouping means and why it's useful?

trans-unit.source: Total Requests: The total number of request processed by the federation service
trans-unit.target: Total Requests: The total number of request processed by the federation service

trans-unit.source: All
trans-unit.target: All

trans-unit.source: This will show the count of total number of requests without grouping.
trans-unit.target: This will show the count of total number of requests without grouping.

trans-unit.source: Application
trans-unit.target: Application

trans-unit.source: This option will group the total requests based on the targeted relying party.
trans-unit.target: This option will group the total requests based on the targeted relying party.

trans-unit.source: This grouping is useful to understand which application is receiving how much percentage of the total traffic.
trans-unit.target: This grouping is useful to understand which application is receiving how much percentage of the total traffic.

trans-unit.source: Server
trans-unit.target: Server

trans-unit.source: This option will group the total requests based on the server that processed the request.
trans-unit.target: This option will group the total requests based on the server that processed the request.

trans-unit.source: This grouping is useful to understand the load distribution of the total traffic.
trans-unit.target: This grouping is useful to understand the load distribution of the total traffic.

trans-unit.source: Workplace Join
trans-unit.target: Workplace Join

trans-unit.source: This option will group the total requests based on if the requests are coming from devices that are workplace joined (known).
trans-unit.target: This option will group the total requests based on if the requests are coming from devices that are workplace joined (known).

trans-unit.source: This grouping is useful to understand if your resources are accessed using devices that are unknown to the identity infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: This grouping is useful to understand if your resources are accessed using devices that are unknown to the identity infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Authentication Method
trans-unit.target: Authentication Method

trans-unit.source: This option will group the total requests based on the authentication method used for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This option will group the total requests based on the authentication method used for authentication.

trans-unit.source: This grouping is useful to understand the common authentication method that gets used for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This grouping is useful to understand the common authentication method that gets used for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Following are the possible authentication methods
trans-unit.target: Following are the possible authentication methods

trans-unit.source: Windows Integrated Authentication (Windows)
trans-unit.target: Windows Integrated Authentication (Windows)

trans-unit.source: Forms Based Authentication (Forms)
trans-unit.target: Forms Based Authentication (Forms)

trans-unit.source: SSO (Single Sign On)
trans-unit.target: SSO (Single Sign On)

trans-unit.source: X509 Certificate Authentication (Certificate)
trans-unit.target: X509 Certificate Authentication (Certificate)

trans-unit.source: Please note that a request is counted as SSO (Single Sign On) if the federation servers receive the request with an SSO Cookie.
trans-unit.target: Please note that a request is counted as SSO (Single Sign On) if the federation servers receive the request with an SSO Cookie.

trans-unit.source: In such cases, if the cookie is valid, the user is not asked to provide credentials and gets seamless access to the application.
trans-unit.target: In such cases, if the cookie is valid, the user is not asked to provide credentials and gets seamless access to the application.

trans-unit.source: This is common if you have multiple relying parties protected by the federation servers.
trans-unit.target: This is common if you have multiple relying parties protected by the federation servers.

trans-unit.source: Network Location
trans-unit.target: Network Location

trans-unit.source: This option will group the total requests based on the network location of the user.
trans-unit.target: This option will group the total requests based on the network location of the user.

trans-unit.source: It can be either intranet or extranet.
trans-unit.target: It can be either intranet or extranet.

trans-unit.source: This grouping is useful to know what percentage of the traffic is coming from the intranet verses extranet.
trans-unit.target: This grouping is useful to know what percentage of the traffic is coming from the intranet verses extranet.

trans-unit.source: Total Failed Requests: The total number failed requests processed by the federation service.
trans-unit.target: Total Failed Requests: The total number failed requests processed by the federation service.

trans-unit.source: (This metric is only available on AD FS for Windows Server 2012 R2)
trans-unit.target: (This metric is only available on AD FS for Windows Server 2012 R2)

trans-unit.source: Error Type
trans-unit.target: Error Type

trans-unit.source: This will show the number of errors based on predefined error types.
trans-unit.target: This will show the number of errors based on predefined error types.

trans-unit.source: This grouping is useful to understand the common types of errors.
trans-unit.target: This grouping is useful to understand the common types of errors.

trans-unit.source: Incorrect Username or Password: Errors due to incorrect username or password.
trans-unit.target: Incorrect Username or Password: Errors due to incorrect username or password.

trans-unit.source: "Extranet Lockout": Failures due to the requests received from a user that was locked out from extranet
trans-unit.target: "Extranet Lockout": Failures due to the requests received from a user that was locked out from extranet

trans-unit.source: "Expired Password": Failures due to users logging in with an expired password.
trans-unit.target: "Expired Password": Failures due to users logging in with an expired password.

trans-unit.source: "Disabled Account": Failures due to users logging with a disabled account.
trans-unit.target: "Disabled Account": Failures due to users logging with a disabled account.

trans-unit.source: "Device Authentication": Failures due to users failing to authenticate using Device Authentication.
trans-unit.target: "Device Authentication": Failures due to users failing to authenticate using Device Authentication.

trans-unit.source: "User Certificate Authentication": Failures due to users failing to authenticate because of an invalid certificate.
trans-unit.target: "User Certificate Authentication": Failures due to users failing to authenticate because of an invalid certificate.

trans-unit.source: "MFA": Failures due to user failing to authenticate using Multi Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: "MFA": Failures due to user failing to authenticate using Multi Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: "Other Credential": "Issuance Authorization": Failures due to authorization failures.
trans-unit.target: "Other Credential": "Issuance Authorization": Failures due to authorization failures.

trans-unit.source: "Issuance Delegation": Failures due to issuance delegation errors.
trans-unit.target: "Issuance Delegation": Failures due to issuance delegation errors.

trans-unit.source: "Token Acceptance": Failures due to ADFS rejecting the token from a 3rd party Identity Provider.
trans-unit.target: "Token Acceptance": Failures due to ADFS rejecting the token from a 3rd party Identity Provider.

trans-unit.source: "Protocol": Failure due to protocol errors.
trans-unit.target: "Protocol": Failure due to protocol errors.

trans-unit.source: "Unknown": Catch all.
trans-unit.target: "Unknown": Catch all.

trans-unit.source: Any other failures that do not fit into the defined categories.
trans-unit.target: Any other failures that do not fit into the defined categories.

trans-unit.source: Server
trans-unit.target: Server

trans-unit.source: This will group the errors based on the server.
trans-unit.target: This will group the errors based on the server.

trans-unit.source: This is useful to understand the error distribution across servers.
trans-unit.target: This is useful to understand the error distribution across servers.

trans-unit.source: Uneven distribution could be an indicator of a server in a faulty state.
trans-unit.target: Uneven distribution could be an indicator of a server in a faulty state.

trans-unit.source: Network Location
trans-unit.target: Network Location

trans-unit.source: This will group the errors based on the network location of the requests (intranet vs extranet).
trans-unit.target: This will group the errors based on the network location of the requests (intranet vs extranet).

trans-unit.source: This is useful to understand the type of requests that are failing.
trans-unit.target: This is useful to understand the type of requests that are failing.

trans-unit.source: Application
trans-unit.target: Application

trans-unit.source: This will group the failures based on the targeted application (relying party).
trans-unit.target: This will group the failures based on the targeted application (relying party).

trans-unit.source: This is useful to understand which targeted application is seeing most number of errors.
trans-unit.target: This is useful to understand which targeted application is seeing most number of errors.

trans-unit.source: User Count: Average number of unique users active in the system
trans-unit.target: User Count: Average number of unique users active in the system

trans-unit.source: All
trans-unit.target: All

trans-unit.source: This provides a count of average number of users using the federation service in the selected time slice.
trans-unit.target: This provides a count of average number of users using the federation service in the selected time slice.

trans-unit.source: The users are not grouped.
trans-unit.target: The users are not grouped.

trans-unit.source: The average will depend on the time slice selected.
trans-unit.target: The average will depend on the time slice selected.

trans-unit.source: Application
trans-unit.target: Application

trans-unit.source: This will group the average number of users based on the targeted application (relying party).
trans-unit.target: This will group the average number of users based on the targeted application (relying party).

trans-unit.source: This is useful to understand how many users are using which application.
trans-unit.target: This is useful to understand how many users are using which application.

trans-unit.source: Performance Monitoring for AD FS
trans-unit.target: Performance Monitoring for AD FS

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Performance Monitoring provides monitoring information on metrics.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Performance Monitoring provides monitoring information on metrics.

trans-unit.source: By selecting the Monitoring box, a blade will open up that provides detailed information on the metrics.
trans-unit.target: By selecting the Monitoring box, a blade will open up that provides detailed information on the metrics.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Portal

trans-unit.source: By selecting the Filter option at the top of the blade, you can filter by server to see an individual server’s metrics.
trans-unit.target: By selecting the Filter option at the top of the blade, you can filter by server to see an individual server’s metrics.

trans-unit.source: To change metrics, simply right-click on the monitoring chart under the monitoring blade and select Edit Chart.
trans-unit.target: To change metrics, simply right-click on the monitoring chart under the monitoring blade and select Edit Chart.

trans-unit.source: Then, from the new blade that opens up, you can select additional metrics from the drop-down and specify a time range for viewing the performance data.
trans-unit.target: Then, from the new blade that opens up, you can select additional metrics from the drop-down and specify a time range for viewing the performance data.
